Detailed Description

StreamReader is a base class for classes implementing a reader from a stream. StreamReaders are accessed from Streams. Subclasses should derived from this base class for the different streams. For example, for a FileStream and corresponding FileStreamReader should be provided.
See also:
StreamWriter

virtual void StreamReader::RequestRead (  StreamingReadInfo &  read_info,
const StreamingCallback *  callback_object = 0
)  [pure virtual]
 

Requests to read the next bytes beginning at the current position.

This is a non-blocking call and the read operation normally is not completed synchroneously. Instead, the stream reader has to respond with a callback CallbackRead to the given call back object callback_object.

The number of bytes to read are given in the read_info object in field nr_bytes_requested. As soon as the requested number of bytes are available, this stream reader is intended to responds with a CallbackRead to the given callback object. However, when the number of bytes requested is set to 0 (!) in the read_info object, the stream reader is intended to respond as soon as any number of bytes are available. Moreover, when the number of bytes cannot be written, the stream reader is intended to respond with an error state.

The result of the operation is stored in read_info, in particular, if the the read operation has been completed synchroneously or not.

See also:
StreamingReadInfo
Parameters:
read_info [in/out] The info object for the information about the read operation.
callback_object [in] The object receiving the asynchroneous callback for this read operation

virtual void StreamReader::Seek (  Stream::Origin  origin,
INT32  offset,
StreamingInfo &  info
)  [pure virtual]
 

Shifts the current reading position of this stream reader offset bytes based on the origin, which might be StreamBegin, StreamEnd, StreamCurrent.

Parameters:
origin[in] the origin of the seek operation
offset[in] the offset for repositioning relativ to the origin
info[in/out] the info object which will give information about this operation
